storyTitle: As Attendance Manager, I want to generate consolidated attendance reports combining biometric and manual data to achieve accurate workforce insights

testCases.title: Validate generation of consolidated attendance reports
preconditions: User is logged in as Attendance Manager with valid credentials
Attendance database contains both biometric and manual attendance data
Reporting module is accessible and functional
User has necessary permissions to access reporting features

steps.action: Navigate to reporting module from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Reporting interface is displayed with available report types, filter options, and generation controls

steps.action: Select 'Consolidated Attendance Report' as report type and apply desired filters (date range, department, etc.), then click 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Consolidated attendance report is displayed showing combined biometric and manual attendance data with accurate employee records, timestamps, and attendance status

steps.action: Click 'Export' button and select 'PDF' format from the export options
steps.expectedResult: PDF file downloads successfully with correct data matching the displayed report, including all columns, formatting, and consolidated attendance information

postconditions: Consolidated report is generated and viewable
PDF export file is saved to local downloads folder
Report generation action is logged in system audit trail

testCases.title: Verify report filtering and export options
preconditions: User is logged in as Attendance Manager
Reporting module is accessible
Attendance database contains multiple employees with varied attendance records
Test data includes specific employee records for the selected date range

steps.action: Navigate to reporting module and select specific employee from employee filter dropdown and set date range using date picker controls
steps.expectedResult: Filters are applied successfully and report displays only attendance data for the selected employee within the specified date range, excluding all other employee records

steps.action: Click 'Export' button and select 'Excel' format from the export options
steps.expectedResult: Excel file downloads successfully with correct filtered data matching the displayed report, maintaining all data integrity, formulas, and formatting in spreadsheet format

postconditions: Filtered report displays accurate subset of attendance data
Excel export file is saved to local downloads folder
Export action is logged in system

testCases.title: Ensure access control for reporting features
preconditions: System has role-based access control configured
Test user accounts exist: one unauthorized user and one attendance manager
Reporting module requires specific permissions to access

steps.action: Login to the system using credentials of an unauthorized user (without attendance manager role)
steps.expectedResult: Access to reporting module is denied with appropriate error message or the reporting module option is not visible in the navigation menu

steps.action: Logout from unauthorized user account and login using attendance manager credentials with proper permissions
steps.expectedResult: Access to reporting module is granted and the reporting interface is displayed with all available features and options visible

postconditions: Unauthorized access attempt is logged in security audit trail
Attendance manager has full access to reporting features
Role-based access control is validated and functioning correctly

storyTitle: As Attendance Manager, I want to resolve conflicts between biometric and manual attendance data to ensure data consistency

testCases.title: Validate automatic conflict detection
preconditions: User is logged in as Attendance Manager
Conflict detection service is running and scheduled hourly
Attendance database is accessible and contains test data
Conflict resolution dashboard is available

steps.action: Create overlapping biometric and manual attendance entries for the same employee at the same time period (e.g., biometric check-in at 9:00 AM and manual entry at 9:05 AM for same date)
steps.expectedResult: System automatically detects the conflict during the next scheduled conflict detection run and lists it in the conflict resolution dashboard with conflict type, employee details, and timestamp information

steps.action: Navigate to conflict resolution interface and locate the newly detected conflict in the conflicts list
steps.expectedResult: Conflict details are displayed correctly showing both conflicting entries (biometric and manual), employee information, date/time of entries, conflict type, and available resolution actions

postconditions: Conflict is detected and logged in the system
Conflict appears in manager's dashboard awaiting resolution
Notification is sent to attendance manager about detected conflict

testCases.title: Verify conflict resolution actions
preconditions: User is logged in as Attendance Manager
Multiple conflicts exist in the conflict resolution dashboard
Test conflicts include various scenarios (overlapping entries, duplicates)
Attendance records are in editable state

steps.action: Select a conflicting entry from the conflict list and click 'Accept' button to accept the selected entry as the correct record
steps.expectedResult: Attendance record is updated with the accepted entry, conflict is removed from the dashboard, and the conflicting alternative entry is discarded or marked as resolved

steps.action: Select another conflicting entry and click 'Reject' button to reject the selected entry
steps.expectedResult: Entry is marked as rejected with appropriate status flag, excluded from all attendance reports and calculations, and conflict is removed from active conflicts list

steps.action: Select a third conflicting entry, click 'Modify' button, make changes to the attendance time or status, and save the modifications
steps.expectedResult: Changes are saved successfully to the attendance record, modified entry replaces the original conflicting entries, conflict is resolved and removed from dashboard, and updated record appears in attendance reports

postconditions: All three conflicts are resolved and removed from pending list
Attendance records are updated according to resolution actions
Reports reflect the resolved attendance data
All resolution actions are logged in audit trail

testCases.title: Ensure audit logging of conflict resolutions
preconditions: User is logged in as Attendance Manager
Audit logging system is enabled and functional
At least one conflict exists in the system
User has permissions to view audit logs

steps.action: Select a conflict from the conflict resolution dashboard, choose a resolution action (accept, reject, or modify), complete the resolution process, then navigate to audit logs section
steps.expectedResult: Resolution action is logged in audit trail with complete details including user ID/name who performed the action, timestamp of resolution, conflict ID, action taken (accept/reject/modify), original conflicting values, final resolved value, and employee affected

postconditions: Audit log entry is permanently stored in the system
Log entry is retrievable and viewable by authorized users
Audit trail maintains data integrity and compliance requirements

storyTitle: As Attendance Manager, I want to audit attendance data synchronization processes to ensure data integrity

testCases.title: Validate logging of synchronization events
preconditions: User is logged in with Attendance Manager role
Biometric attendance system is connected and operational
Manual attendance data is available for synchronization
Synchronization logs database is accessible
User has permissions to access synchronization audit interface

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance data synchronization module
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization module interface is displayed with available data sources

steps.action: Select biometric and manual attendance data sources for synchronization
steps.expectedResult: Data sources are selected and synchronization options are displayed

steps.action: Initiate attendance data synchronization by clicking 'Synchronize' button
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization process starts and progress indicator is displayed

steps.action: Wait for synchronization process to complete
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization completes successfully with status message displayed

steps.action: Verify that synchronization event is logged with status and timestamp in the system
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization event is recorded in logs with 'Success' status, timestamp, data source details, and number of records synchronized

steps.action: Navigate to synchronization audit interface from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization audit interface loads displaying list of synchronization events

steps.action: Locate the most recent synchronization event in the audit logs
steps.expectedResult: The synchronization event performed in previous steps appears in audit logs with correct timestamp, status, and event details

steps.action: Verify the event appears within 1 minute of synchronization completion
steps.expectedResult: Event timestamp confirms log entry was created within 1 minute of synchronization event occurrence

postconditions: Synchronization event is permanently logged in the database
Audit trail is available for future review
Attendance data is synchronized between biometric and manual systems
System remains in operational state

testCases.title: Verify filtering and export of synchronization audit logs
preconditions: User is logged in with Attendance Manager role
Multiple synchronization events exist in the system with different dates and statuses
At least 5 successful synchronization events are logged
At least 2 failed synchronization events are logged
User has permissions to view and export audit logs
Synchronization audit interface is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to synchronization audit interface
steps.expectedResult: Audit interface loads displaying all synchronization events in chronological order

steps.action: Verify that filter options are available (date range, status, data source)
steps.expectedResult: Filter panel is displayed with date range picker, status dropdown (Success/Failed/In Progress), and data source options

steps.action: Select a specific date range using the date filter (e.g., last 7 days)
steps.expectedResult: Date range is selected and applied to the filter

steps.action: Select 'Success' status from the status filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Status filter is applied showing only successful synchronization events

steps.action: Click 'Apply Filters' button
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs are filtered and display only successful synchronization events within the selected date range

steps.action: Verify filtered results show correct data matching filter criteria
steps.expectedResult: All displayed events have 'Success' status and timestamps within the selected date range

steps.action: Change status filter to 'Failed' and apply
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs update to display only failed synchronization events within the date range

steps.action: Click 'Export' button and select CSV format
steps.expectedResult: Export dialog appears with CSV format selected and file name suggestion displayed

steps.action: Confirm export by clicking 'Download' button
steps.expectedResult: CSV file downloads successfully to local system within 5 seconds

steps.action: Open the downloaded CSV file
steps.expectedResult: CSV file opens correctly with columns: Event ID, Timestamp, Status, Data Source, Records Synchronized, Duration, User

steps.action: Verify CSV data matches the filtered audit logs displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: All rows in CSV match the filtered results with correct data in all columns

postconditions: Filtered audit logs remain displayed in the interface
CSV file is saved in downloads folder
Audit logs database remains unchanged
Filter settings can be cleared or modified for subsequent queries

testCases.title: Ensure alert generation for synchronization failures
preconditions: User is logged in with Attendance Manager role
Synchronization system is operational
Alert notification system is configured and enabled
User has permissions to receive synchronization alerts
Test environment allows simulation of synchronization failures
Email/notification channels are configured for alerts

steps.action: Navigate to synchronization audit interface
steps.expectedResult: Audit interface is displayed with current synchronization status

steps.action: Access synchronization test/simulation module or disconnect biometric data source to simulate failure
steps.expectedResult: Test mode is activated or data source connection is interrupted

steps.action: Initiate attendance data synchronization process
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization process starts and attempts to connect to data sources

steps.action: Wait for synchronization process to fail due to simulated error
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization process fails with error message displayed on screen

steps.action: Verify that system generates an alert notification for the synchronization failure
steps.expectedResult: Alert notification appears in the system notification panel with failure details including timestamp, error type, and affected data source

steps.action: Check email or configured notification channel for alert message
steps.expectedResult: Alert email/notification is received with subject 'Synchronization Failure Alert' containing failure details and timestamp

steps.action: Navigate to synchronization audit logs
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs interface displays the list of synchronization events

steps.action: Locate the failed synchronization event in the audit logs
steps.expectedResult: Failed synchronization event appears in logs with 'Failed' status, timestamp, error message, and failure reason

steps.action: Verify the failure event was logged within 1 minute of occurrence
steps.expectedResult: Event timestamp confirms log entry was created within 1 minute of synchronization failure

steps.action: Click on the failed event to view detailed error information
steps.expectedResult: Detailed view opens showing complete error stack trace, affected records count, and recommended resolution steps

steps.action: Verify alert contains actionable information for troubleshooting
steps.expectedResult: Alert includes error code, description, affected system components, and suggested corrective actions

postconditions: Synchronization failure is logged in audit database
Alert notification is recorded in notification history
System remains operational for other functions
Failed synchronization can be retried after resolving the issue
Alert recipients are notified of the failure
